original: @79b # // rgya gar skad du /
analyzed: @79b # // rgya gar skad du /
translated: In Sanskrit:

original: sa m'a dhi sambh'a ra pa ri ba rta n'a ma /
analyzed: sa m'a dhi sambh'a ra pa ri ba rta n'a ma /
translated: Samādhisambhāraparivarta-nāma

original: bod skad du /
analyzed: bod skad du /
translated: In Tibetan:

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u zhes bya ba /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u zhes bya ba /
translated: The Chapter on the Accumulation of Meditative Absorption

original: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' thams cad la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas!🔽I pay homage to the lords of sages and their sons,

original: srid pa ji srid bar du bzhugs pa yi //🔽@80a * // thub dbang sras bcas rnams la phyag 'tshal te //🔽gsang sngags mdo sde pha rol phyin pa yi //
analyzed: srid pa ji srid bar du bzhugs pa yi // @80a * // thub dbang sras bcas rnams la phyag 'tshal te // gsang sngags mdo sde pha rol phyin pa yi //
translated: who remain as long as existence endures,🔽and will explain the chapter on the accumulation of meditative absorption,

original: mdo sde'i rjes 'gro ting 'dzin tshogs le'u brjod //
analyzed: mdo sde'i rjes 'gro ting 'dzin tshogs le'u brjod //
translated: which follows the sutras of the mantra vehicle, perfection vehicle, and sutra piṭaka.

original: deng song skye bo phal cher bdud kyi lcags kyus bzung ste khyim gyi btson ra dam por bcug / bdud kyi 'jig rten skyong bzhis khrims phas bsrungs shing sred sogs 'ching bas rab tu dam por bcings //
analyzed: deng song skye bo phal cher bdud kyi lcags kyus bzung ste khyim gyi btson ra dam por bcug / bdud kyi 'jig rten skyong bzhis khrims phas bsrungs shing sred sogs 'ching bas rab tu dam por bcings //
translated: Nowadays, most people are caught by the hook of Māra, confined in the tight prison of the household, guarded by the four Māra-worldly protectors, and tightly bound by the fetters of craving and so forth.

original: sdom brtson dag kyang phal cher bdud kyi 'jig rten skyong bzhi'i dbang du gyur cing dge sbyong gi / gnas dang tshul spangs khyim pa rnams dang spyod mtshungs ngan 'gro'i g-yang sar mngon phyogs mtho ris spang //
analyzed: sdom brtson dag kyang phal cher bdud kyi 'jig rten skyong bzhi'i dbang du gyur cing dge sbyong gi / gnas dang tshul spangs khyim pa rnams dang spyod mtshungs ngan 'gro'i g-yang sar mngon phyogs mtho ris spang //
translated: Most of the monks are under the power of the four demons who protect the world. They have abandoned the way of life of a monk and are like householders. They are headed for the abyss of the lower realms. They have abandoned the higher realms.

original: de phyir 'di ni bdag nyid dran phyir byas kyi gzhan la phan pa'i re ba yod ma yin //
analyzed: de phyir 'di ni bdag nyid dran phyir byas kyi gzhan la phan pa'i re ba yod ma yin //
translated: Therefore, I have written this for my own memory, not with the hope of benefiting others.

original: 'on kyang bdag dang skal ba mnyam pa la la gnas 'dir dga' na yang dag rtogs pas smra 'di nyon //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag dang skal ba mnyam pa la la gnas 'dir dga' na yang dag rtogs pas smra 'di nyon //
translated: However, if someone of similar fortune to me were to find joy in this place, may they listen to this speech of one who has realized the truth.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi yan lag ni rnam pa dgu ste /
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi yan lag ni rnam pa dgu ste /
translated: The limbs of the accumulation of samādhi are ninefold:

original: spang bar bya ba dang / sngon du 'gro ba dang / ldog par bya ba dang ; gdung ba bcad pa dang / yid 'byung bar bya ba dang / yon tan rjes su dran par bya ba dang / brtson par bya ba dang / 'brel par bya ba dang /
analyzed: spang bar bya ba dang / sngon du 'gro ba dang / ldog par bya ba dang ; gdung ba bcad pa dang / yid 'byung bar bya ba dang / yon tan rjes su dran par bya ba dang / brtson par bya ba dang / 'brel par bya ba dang /
translated: the object of abandonment, the preliminary, the object of reversal, the cutting of anguish, the object of disenchantment, the object of remembering good qualities, the object of exertion, the object of connection, and the object of attainment.

original: gnas pa'i thabs zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: gnas pa'i thabs zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: The “means of abiding” are the four means of gathering [disciples].

original: de la spang bar bya ba ni bdud kyi las so //
analyzed: de la spang bar bya ba ni bdud kyi las so //
translated: The “things to be abandoned” are the works of Māra.

original: de la bdud ni gang /
analyzed: de la bdud ni gang /
translated: What is Māra?

original: de'i las ni gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i las ni gang zhe na /
translated: What are his works?

original: bdud ni 'dod pa'i lha sdig can zhes bya ba la chung ma padma'i phreng ba can dang / 'khor 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi dang / bdud kyi rigs kyi yi dags dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdud ni 'dod pa'i lha sdig can zhes bya ba la chung ma padma'i phreng ba can dang / 'khor 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi dang / bdud kyi rigs kyi yi dags dang bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Māra is the evil god of the desire realm, together with his wife Padmaśikhin, his retinue of the four world guardians, and the pretas of the Māra class.

original: de dag gi las ni 'dod pa'i lha de chung ma dang bcas pa'i spyi bo na me tog gi mda' lnga yod pa ni /
analyzed: de dag gi las ni 'dod pa'i lha de chung ma dang bcas pa'i spyi bo na me tog gi mda' lnga yod pa ni /
translated: The works of those [beings] are as follows. On the crown of the head of that desire god together with his wife are five flower arrows.

original: 'di lta ste dregs par byed pa dang / rmongs par byed pa dang / kun tu rmongs par byed pa dang / brgyal bar byed pa dang / sems med par byed pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste dregs par byed pa dang / rmongs par byed pa dang / kun tu rmongs par byed pa dang / brgyal bar byed pa dang / sems med par byed pa zhes bya ba rnams so //
translated: They are called “the one that causes arrogance,” “the one that causes delusion,” “the one that causes complete delusion,” “the one that causes fainting,” and “the one that causes the mind to be absent.”

original: de'i me tog de dag bsnun pa de phog pa las nyon mongs pa lnga gang shas che ba de la des phog pa kho nar rab tu 'bar bar gyur te /
analyzed: de'i me tog de dag bsnun pa de phog pa las nyon mongs pa lnga gang shas che ba de la des phog pa kho nar rab tu 'bar bar gyur te /
translated: When those flowers strike, wherever the five afflictions are strongest, that [arrow] strikes and blazes.

original: de'i dbang du song zhing thar pa dang mngon par mtho ba las nyams par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de'i dbang du song zhing thar pa dang mngon par mtho ba las nyams par 'gyur ro ;
translated: One who is under the influence of these will fall from liberation and from high status.

original: / de'i 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: / de'i 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The four guardians of the world are as follows:

original: 'thab par byed pa dang / g-yeng bar byed pa dang / lhag par rab tu chags pa dang / 'du shes log pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'thab par byed pa dang / g-yeng bar byed pa dang / lhag par rab tu chags pa dang / 'du shes log pa zhes bya'o //
translated: the māra that causes strife, the māra that causes distraction, the māra that causes excessive attachment, and the māra that causes mistaken notions.

original: bdud de dag gi las ni tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: bdud de dag gi las ni tha dad pa ste /
translated: The activities of these māras are different.

original: 'di ltar 'thab par byed pa'i bdud des ni lam bsgom pa dag 'thab pa dang / @80b rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa la 'jug cing de'i rkyen 'bad pas sgrub bo //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'thab par byed pa'i bdud des ni lam bsgom pa dag 'thab pa dang / @80b rtsod pa dang / 'gyed pa la 'jug cing de'i rkyen 'bad pas sgrub bo //
translated: Thus, the māra that causes strife causes those who are cultivating the path to engage in strife, disputes, and quarrels, and it causes them to strive for the conditions of that.

original: g-yeng bar byed pa'i bdud des ni lam bsgom pa dag gnyid dang rmugs pa rab tu 'phel ba'am /
analyzed: g-yeng bar byed pa'i bdud des ni lam bsgom pa dag gnyid dang rmugs pa rab tu 'phel ba'am /
translated: The māra that causes distraction causes those who are cultivating the path to increase their sleep and lethargy,

original: chos nyan pa dag kyang gnyid la rab tu sbyor ba'am /
analyzed: chos nyan pa dag kyang gnyid la rab tu sbyor ba'am /
translated: or it causes those who are listening to the Dharma to apply themselves to sleep,

original: kha cig rab tu g-yeng bar yang byed par gnas so //
analyzed: kha cig rab tu g-yeng bar yang byed par gnas so //
translated: or it causes some to be distracted.

original: lhag par rab tu chags pa'i bdud des ni phal cher khyim na gnas pa la bar du gcod de /
analyzed: lhag par rab tu chags pa'i bdud des ni phal cher khyim na gnas pa la bar du gcod de /
translated: The māra that causes excessive attachment mostly creates obstacles for householders.

original: sbyin pa'i dus nye bar gnas pa na bu dang bu mo dang chung ma dang bdag nyid longs ci spyad ces de rang gi sha la gcod pa snyam byed pa'i 'du shes nye bar bsgrub bo /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i dus nye bar gnas pa na bu dang bu mo dang chung ma dang bdag nyid longs ci spyad ces de rang gi sha la gcod pa snyam byed pa'i 'du shes nye bar bsgrub bo /
translated: When the time comes to practice generosity, he should cultivate the perception that he is cutting off his own flesh.

original: 'du shes log pa'i bdud gang yin pa des ni phal cher rab tu byung ba'i phyogs sun 'byin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'du shes log pa'i bdud gang yin pa des ni phal cher rab tu byung ba'i phyogs sun 'byin par byed pa ste /
translated: The demon of false perception mostly causes those who have gone forth to be defiled.

original: 'di ltar rab tu byung ba'i sems nye bar gnas pa na 'khrig pa'i bde ba dang / bza' ba dang btung ba'i bde ba dang / rang gi skye bo'i tshogs dang / glu gar la sogs pa dran pas chags pa dang / de'i rang gi skye bos slu ba dang /
analyzed: 'di ltar rab tu byung ba'i sems nye bar gnas pa na 'khrig pa'i bde ba dang / bza' ba dang btung ba'i bde ba dang / rang gi skye bo'i tshogs dang / glu gar la sogs pa dran pas chags pa dang / de'i rang gi skye bos slu ba dang /
translated: For when the mind of one who has gone forth is settled, he remembers the pleasures of sex, the pleasures of food and drink, his own family and friends, and singing and dancing, and he becomes attached. His own family and friends deceive him,

original: 'drid pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / bzung bas de'i nges par 'byung ba'i bar chad byed du 'jug go //
analyzed: 'drid pa dang / bsdigs pa dang / bzung bas de'i nges par 'byung ba'i bar chad byed du 'jug go //
translated: cheat him, threaten him, and hold him back from liberation.

original: rab tu byung ba dag la yang bud med kyi mtshan ma dag yid la byed pa dang / sngon bgad pa dang / rtses pa dag dran par byed pa dang / tshong dang zhing las dang rang gi 'brel pa dang / yid gcugs par bya ba'i sems bskyed cing /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba dag la yang bud med kyi mtshan ma dag yid la byed pa dang / sngon bgad pa dang / rtses pa dag dran par byed pa dang / tshong dang zhing las dang rang gi 'brel pa dang / yid gcugs par bya ba'i sems bskyed cing /
translated: They also cause those who have gone forth to think about the signs of women, to remember their former laughter and play, to engage in business, farming, and their own affairs, and to develop thoughts of intimacy.

original: rmi lam na bud med du sprul cing des chags pa dang sa bon 'byung bar byed la /
analyzed: rmi lam na bud med du sprul cing des chags pa dang sa bon 'byung bar byed la /
translated: They transform themselves into women in dreams and cause the emission of semen.

original: sna tshogs kyis kyang rab tu byung ba las 'bebs shing /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyis kyang rab tu byung ba las 'bebs shing /
translated: They also cause various things to happen that lead to the downfall of those who have gone forth.

original: de dag gi tshangs par spyod pa dri ma can du yang byed do //
analyzed: de dag gi tshangs par spyod pa dri ma can du yang byed do //
translated: They also cause the pure conduct of those who have gone forth to become defiled.

original: 'di dag bzhi char yang 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams sdug bsngal bar bya ba'i phyir klu ma rungs pa dag bskul la /
analyzed: 'di dag bzhi char yang 'dzam bu'i gling pa rnams sdug bsngal bar bya ba'i phyir klu ma rungs pa dag bskul la /
translated: All four of these are summoned by evil nāgas in order to cause suffering to the people of Jambudvīpa.

original: lha ma yin dag bskul zhing lo tog ma rungs par byed /
analyzed: lha ma yin dag bskul zhing lo tog ma rungs par byed /
translated: They summon the asuras and cause the crops to be destroyed.

original: mi chos dang ldan pa'i srog 'phrog cing /
analyzed: mi chos dang ldan pa'i srog 'phrog cing /
translated: They steal the lives of people who are righteous.

original: lus la nad sna tshogs gtong bar byed de /
analyzed: lus la nad sna tshogs gtong bar byed de /
translated: They cause various diseases to arise in the bodies of people.

original: ji ltar rgyal po bzhi po dag chos ma yin pa la spyod pa dag la chad pa sbyin pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar rgyal po bzhi po dag chos ma yin pa la spyod pa dag la chad pa sbyin pa ltar /
translated: Just as the four kings punish those who engage in non-Dharma,

original: 'di dag ni chos dang ldan pa rnams la chad pa sbyin no //
analyzed: 'di dag ni chos dang ldan pa rnams la chad pa sbyin no //
translated: these punish those who engage in Dharma.

original: bdud kyi rigs kyi yi dags ni yi dags kyi rigs sum cu rtsa drug las 'di dag rigs gcig tu bgrang ba yin te /
analyzed: bdud kyi rigs kyi yi dags ni yi dags kyi rigs sum cu rtsa drug las 'di dag rigs gcig tu bgrang ba yin te /
translated: The ghosts of the Mara class are counted as one class out of the thirty-six classes of ghosts.

original: de dag gi bdud kyi las ni bsam gtan pa dag la rmi lam du 'jigs pa skyed par byed /🔽sangs rgyas kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis @81a * //
analyzed: de dag gi bdud kyi las ni bsam gtan pa dag la rmi lam du 'jigs pa skyed par byed / sangs rgyas kyi sku mtshan dang dpe byad kyis @81a * //
translated: Their Mara activities are to generate fear in meditators through dreams,

original: spras pa nye bar ston pas bar du gcod /
analyzed: spras pa nye bar ston pas bar du gcod /
translated: to create obstacles by displaying the body of the Buddha adorned with the major and minor marks,

original: bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag pa na sgra chen po sgrogs par byed do //🔽mdor na bdud dang bdud kyi rigs su gtogs pa rnams ni yang dag par zhugs pa thams cad la chags pa bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: bsam gtan la mnyam par gzhag pa na sgra chen po sgrogs par byed do // mdor na bdud dang bdud kyi rigs su gtogs pa rnams ni yang dag par zhugs pa thams cad la chags pa bskyed pa'am /
translated: and to shout loudly when one is equipoised in concentration.

original: 'jigs pa bskyed pas bar du gcod de /
analyzed: 'jigs pa bskyed pas bar du gcod de /
translated: In brief, the Maras and those belonging to the Mara class create obstacles for all who are correctly engaged by generating attachment or🔽fear.

original: de ltar yang 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtog pa las /
analyzed: de ltar yang 'jig rten gsum las rnam par rgyal ba'i rtog pa las /
translated: Thus, the Tantra of the Conquering of the Three Worlds says:

original: mi zad brtul zhugs bzung ba yi //
analyzed: mi zad brtul zhugs bzung ba yi //
translated: Those who have taken up the vow of austerity🔽are harmed by the demon class

original: sgrub pa la ni bdud kyi rigs //
analyzed: sgrub pa la ni bdud kyi rigs //
translated: in the practice of the rite.🔽The goddesses in the form of desire

original: lha mo 'dod pa'i gzugs dag dang // de bzhin gzhan gyi lus su yang //
analyzed: lha mo 'dod pa'i gzugs dag dang // de bzhin gzhan gyi lus su yang //
translated: and likewise in other bodies

original: rnam pa sna tshogs gzugs dag gis //
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs gzugs dag gis //
translated: in various forms

original: dbang po bsdams la 'tshe bar byed //🔽ces gsungs te /
analyzed: dbang po bsdams la 'tshe bar byed // ces gsungs te /
translated: harm those who restrain the senses.

original: 'dir brtul zhugs bzung ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: 'dir brtul zhugs bzung ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: Here, taking up the vow of austerity is an illustration.

original: sems las su rung ba thams cad la yang de dag nye bar 'tshe bar byed do //
analyzed: sems las su rung ba thams cad la yang de dag nye bar 'tshe bar byed do //
translated: They harm all those who have a serviceable mind.

original: de lta bu'i bdud kyi las de dag su zhig las 'byung zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bdud kyi las de dag su zhig las 'byung zhe na /
translated: From what kind of person do such demonic actions arise?

original: bsam pa dag pas yang dag par brtson pa dag las 'byung ste /
analyzed: bsam pa dag pas yang dag par brtson pa dag las 'byung ste /
translated: They arise from those who are pure in intention and strive properly.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par 'phrul pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa 'jam dpal rnam par 'phrul pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As the noble Manifold Good says,

original: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las ci las 'byung bar rig par bya /
analyzed: 'jam dpal byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las ci las 'byung bar rig par bya /
translated: “Mañjuśrī, from what should the bodhisattva know the demonic actions to arise?”🔽“Mañjuśrī, they should be known to arise from the purity of intention and the proper striving of the bodhisattvas.”

original: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
analyzed: 'jam dpal gyis smras pa /
translated: Mañjuśrī said:

original: lha'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las ni brtson 'grus las 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i bu byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bdud kyi las ni brtson 'grus las 'byung bar rig par bya ste /
translated: Divine son, you should know that the deeds of Māra that arise for bodhisattvas come from their diligence.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: mi brtson pa la ni bdud kyis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: mi brtson pa la ni bdud kyis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What could Māra do to someone who is not diligent?

original: de nyid bdud yin pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid bdud yin pa'i phyir ro zhes so //
translated: Because that person is already Māra.

original: de ltar bdud kyi las shes pas de bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar bdud kyi las shes pas de bzlog par bya ste /
translated: Thus, by knowing the deeds of Māra, you should avert them.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa lha'i bu rin po che mchog gis zhus pa las gsungs pa /🔽gang gi tshe bdud kyi las rtog pa de lta bu ni kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa lha'i bu rin po che mchog gis zhus pa las gsungs pa / gang gi tshe bdud kyi las rtog pa de lta bu ni kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: As the Questions of the Devaputra Ratnavyūha Sūtra says:🔽When you think about the deeds of Māra, they are blameless.

original: gang yang bdud kyi las rnams bzlog pa de lta bu'i dpyas med pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gang yang bdud kyi las rnams bzlog pa de lta bu'i dpyas med pa yin no zhes so //
translated: When you avert the deeds of Māra, they are also blameless.

original: de ma bzlog par ni rnam par thar pa mi thob pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de ma bzlog par ni rnam par thar pa mi thob pa kho na ste /
translated: If you do not avert them, you will not attain liberation.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyis zhus pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyis zhus pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As the Questions of Subāhu Sūtra says:

original: bgegs kyis bsod nams ma lus zad par byed //
analyzed: bgegs kyis bsod nams ma lus zad par byed //
translated: Obstructors destroy all your merit.

original: de bas mi la gsang sngags 'grub mi byed //
analyzed: de bas mi la gsang sngags 'grub mi byed //
translated: Therefore, the secret mantra is not accomplished by a human.

original: ji ltar zla ba sprin las rnam grol ltar //
analyzed: ji ltar zla ba sprin las rnam grol ltar //
translated: Just as the moon is freed from clouds,

original: de bzhin bgegs las grol ba rnam par gsal //
analyzed: de bzhin bgegs las grol ba rnam par gsal //
translated: so too is one freed from obstacles and is radiant.

original: zhes te / 'dir bgegs kyang gnyis te /🔽rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzhig par bya ba'i phyir sbyor @81b ba lha'i bu'i bdud dang / de la gzhan pa ni ji skad du /
analyzed: zhes te / 'dir bgegs kyang gnyis te / rdzogs pa'i byang chub gzhig par bya ba'i phyir sbyor @81b ba lha'i bu'i bdud dang / de la gzhan pa ni ji skad du /
translated: Here, there are two kinds of obstacles:

original: 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyi sa zhus pa las /🔽gtor ma 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyi sa zhus pa las / gtor ma 'dod pa'am /
translated: the māra of the sons of the gods, who is applied in order to destroy perfect enlightenment, and the others, as it is said in the Questions of Subāhu Sūtra:🔽“The obstacles are of two kinds:🔽those that desire a bali offering,

original: rtsed mo byed 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: rtsed mo byed 'dod pa'am /
translated: those that desire play,

original: gsang ba'i don du lus la 'bab cing 'jug ces te /
analyzed: gsang ba'i don du lus la 'bab cing 'jug ces te /
translated: and those that descend on the body for the sake of the secret.

original: 'dir de gnyis ka bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir de gnyis ka bzlog par bya'o //
translated: Here, both of those are to be averted.

original: thabs gang gis bzlog par bya zhe na /
analyzed: thabs gang gis bzlog par bya zhe na /
translated: By what method are they averted?

original: ji skad du 'phags pa rdo rje rtse mo las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa rdo rje rtse mo las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Vajraśekhara Tantra:

original: rang gi sems ni bdud ces gsungs //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni bdud ces gsungs //
translated: One’s mind is said to be a māra.

original: rang gi sems nyid bgegs yin no //🔽rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs //
analyzed: rang gi sems nyid bgegs yin no // rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs //
translated: One’s mind itself is an obstacle.🔽Abandon all discursive thoughts.

original: bgegs kun rnam par rtog las 'byung //
analyzed: bgegs kun rnam par rtog las 'byung //
translated: All obstacles arise from discursive thought.

original: zhes pa'o // gzhan yang bdud kyi las bzlog pa'i thabs ni /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gzhan yang bdud kyi las bzlog pa'i thabs ni /
translated: This is the branch of relinquishment.

original: 'phags pa mya ngan med kyis byin pas zhus pa dang / 'phags pa seng ge lung bstan pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa mya ngan med kyis byin pas zhus pa dang / 'phags pa seng ge lung bstan pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the method for averting the activities of Māra should be understood from the Questions of Ārya Aśokadatta and the Ārya Siṃhavyūha.

original: 'di ni spang bar bya ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: 'di ni spang bar bya ba'i yan lag go //
translated: This is the branch of relinquishment.

original: gang gis thos pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes rab ma skyes pa des ni bdud kyi las bzlog par mi nus shing sems mnyam par 'jog par yang mi nus pas na /
analyzed: gang gis thos pa'i rang bzhin gyis shes rab ma skyes pa des ni bdud kyi las bzlog par mi nus shing sems mnyam par 'jog par yang mi nus pas na /
translated: One who has not generated the wisdom that comes from hearing will not be able to avert the activities of Māra and will not be able to rest the mind in equipoise.

original: dang por thos pa nyid sngon du bya ste /
analyzed: dang por thos pa nyid sngon du bya ste /
translated: Therefore, first one should engage in hearing.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: shes rab rgyas byed pa ni thos pa ste //
analyzed: shes rab rgyas byed pa ni thos pa ste //
translated: Hearing causes wisdom to expand.

original: bsam pa dang ni gnyis po yod gyur na //
analyzed: bsam pa dang ni gnyis po yod gyur na //
translated: When there is both hearing and reflection,

original: de nas bsgom pa la ni sbyar ba ste //
analyzed: de nas bsgom pa la ni sbyar ba ste //
translated: then one should apply oneself to meditation.

original: de las dngos grub bla na med pa thob //
analyzed: de las dngos grub bla na med pa thob //
translated: From that, one attains the highest spiritual power.

original: ces bshad la /
analyzed: ces bshad la /
translated: It is explained.

original: 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dkod  pa bcu bstan pa'i le'u las kyang /
analyzed: 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dkod  pa bcu bstan pa'i le'u las kyang /
translated: And in the chapter that teaches the ten arrays of the bodhisattva in the Ārya Bodhisattvabhūmi,

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' las dang po ba de ni thog ma nyid du kha ton la bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras byang chub sems dpa' las dang po ba de ni thog ma nyid du kha ton la bskul bar bya'o //
translated: O son of the victors, the bodhisattva who is a beginner should first of all be encouraged to recite.

original: mang du thos nas dben par gnas pa la bskul bar bya'o zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: mang du thos nas dben par gnas pa la bskul bar bya'o zhes gsungs la /
translated: Having heard much, he should be encouraged to live in solitude.

original: don de ltar 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa dang / 'phags pa dkon mchog sgron ma las kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: don de ltar 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa dang / 'phags pa dkon mchog sgron ma las kyang gsungs so //
translated: This point is also taught in the noble Inquiry of Ugra and in the noble Jewel Cloud.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las kyang /
translated: Similarly, the noble Array of Stalks says,

original: thog mar nyan 'dod bla ma bsnyen bkur bzod dang des byas shing //
analyzed: thog mar nyan 'dod bla ma bsnyen bkur bzod dang des byas shing //
translated: First, wishing to hear, he serves the guru with patience and respect.

original: rang bzhin med pa'i chos la rab rtog bsam gtan rnyed byed pa //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa'i chos la rab rtog bsam gtan rnyed byed pa //
translated: He finds concentration, well understanding the dharma of nonexistence.

original: bde gshegs nyid ni rtogs 'gyur 'gro ba rnams skom sems tshim byed //
analyzed: bde gshegs nyid ni rtogs 'gyur 'gro ba rnams skom sems tshim byed //
translated: He realizes the state of a sugata, satisfying the thirst of the world.

original: chos nyid de 'dra spyod pa myur du bde gshegs thob par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos nyid de 'dra spyod pa myur du bde gshegs thob par 'gyur // zhes gsungs so //
translated: He quickly attains the state of a sugata, practicing the suchness of dharmas.

original: de bzhin du 'phags pa nyan thos kyi so sor thar pa'i mdo las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'phags pa nyan thos kyi so sor thar pa'i mdo las kyang /
translated: And the noble Sūtra on the Application of Mindfulness to the Holy also says,

original: mang du thos pa nags kyi nang dag tu //🔽lang tsho yol ba rnams kyi gnas pa @82a * //
analyzed: mang du thos pa nags kyi nang dag tu // lang tsho yol ba rnams kyi gnas pa @82a * //
translated: The learned ones are happy in the forest,

original: bde // zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bde // zhes gsungs te /
translated: and those who have passed youth are happy in solitude.

original: de bas na thos pa'i shes rab nyid don sgrub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de bas na thos pa'i shes rab nyid don sgrub pa'i sngon du 'gro ba'o //
translated: Thus, the wisdom of learning is the prerequisite for accomplishing the goal.

original: 'di ni sngon du 'gro ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: 'di ni sngon du 'gro ba'i yan lag go //
translated: This is the prerequisite limb.

original: de ltar thos pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de chos smra ba la 'jug pa dgag par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar thos pa dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de chos smra ba la 'jug pa dgag par bya ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has thus become learned should be restrained from engaging in teaching Dharma.

original: mngon par shes pa ma thob par mang du thos pa tsam gyis gzhan la phan gdags par rgyal bas ma gsungs te /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa ma thob par mang du thos pa tsam gyis gzhan la phan gdags par rgyal bas ma gsungs te /
translated: The Victorious One has not taught that merely being learned without attaining superknowledge can benefit others.

original: de bas na 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dgod pa bcu bstan pa'i le'u las /
analyzed: de bas na 'phags pa byang chub sems dpa' rnam par dgod pa bcu bstan pa'i le'u las /
translated: Therefore, in the chapter on the exposition of the ten stages of the bodhisattva,🔽it says:

original: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa de ni thog ma nyid du kha ton la bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las dang po pa de ni thog ma nyid du kha ton la bskul bar bya'o //
translated: The beginner bodhisattva should first be encouraged to recite.

original: mang du thos nas dben par gnas pa la bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mang du thos nas dben par gnas pa la bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Having become learned, he should be encouraged to dwell in solitude.

original: rab tu dben par gyur nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur par yongs su bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben par gyur nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen du gyur par yongs su bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Having become secluded, they should be inspired to become spiritual friends.

original: dge ba'i bshes su gyur nas nga lo bde ba la bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes su gyur nas nga lo bde ba la bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Having become spiritual friends, they should be inspired to make others happy.

original: nga lo bde bar gyur nas dus shes pa la bskul bar bya'o //🔽dus shes par gyur nas mi 'jigs pa la yongs su bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: nga lo bde bar gyur nas dus shes pa la bskul bar bya'o // dus shes par gyur nas mi 'jigs pa la yongs su bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Having made others happy, they should be inspired to know the right time.🔽Having come to know the right time, they should be inspired to be fearless.

original: mi 'jigs par gyur nas don shes pa la yongs su bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs par gyur nas don shes pa la yongs su bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Having become fearless, they should be inspired to understand the meaning.

original: don shes par gyur nas chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la yongs su bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: don shes par gyur nas chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba la yongs su bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Having understood the meaning, they should be inspired to follow the Dharma.

original: chos kyi rjes su 'brang bar gyur nas rmongs pa med pa la bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi rjes su 'brang bar gyur nas rmongs pa med pa la bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Having followed the Dharma, they should be inspired to be free from confusion.

original: rmongs pa med par gyur nas rnam par dgod pa la yongs su bskul bar bya'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa med par gyur nas rnam par dgod pa la yongs su bskul bar bya'o //
translated: Having become free from confusion, they should be inspired to be well-established.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: de bas kyang shas cher sems can thams cad snying rje chen po sngon du 'jog par bya ba dang / gnas gang thos kyang de la bdag nyid sbyor bar bya ba dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi dring 'jog par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de bas kyang shas cher sems can thams cad snying rje chen po sngon du 'jog par bya ba dang / gnas gang thos kyang de la bdag nyid sbyor bar bya ba dang / bdag dang gzhan gyi dring 'jog par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: Moreover, it is in order to place great compassion at the forefront for all sentient beings, to apply oneself to whatever is heard, and to avoid being swayed by oneself or others.

original: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di ni las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dgod pa'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: kye rgyal ba'i sras dag 'di ni las dang po pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par dgod pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: O sons of the Victorious Ones, this is the arrangement for beginner bodhisattvas.

original: don 'di nyid 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa dang / dkon mchog sgron ma las kyang gsungs so //
analyzed: don 'di nyid 'phags pa drag shul can gyis zhus pa dang / dkon mchog sgron ma las kyang gsungs so //
translated: This very meaning is also stated in the noble Inquiry of Ugra and the Jewel Lamp Dhāraṇī.

original: gzhan yang 'phags pa lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba'i mdo las kyang /🔽bdag ni sgrub nyams da ni ci bya zhes //
analyzed: gzhan yang 'phags pa lhag pa'i bsam pa bskul ba'i mdo las kyang / bdag ni sgrub nyams da ni ci bya zhes //
translated: Moreover, the noble Exhortation to Wholehearted Resolve also says:

original: byis pa 'chi ba'i dus na mya ngan byed //
analyzed: byis pa 'chi ba'i dus na mya ngan byed //
translated: At the time of death, fools are miserable,🔽thinking, “I have failed to practice; what can I do now?”

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa mang du thos pa dben pa mi bsten par chos smra ba las /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa mang du thos pa dben pa mi bsten par chos smra ba las /
translated: Thus, those with much learning who do not rely on solitude, but instead rely on Dharma teachers,

original: nyes pa rnam pa rab tu mang po gsungs pas der zhib tu blta'o //
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa rab tu mang po gsungs pas der zhib tu blta'o //
translated: Since many faults are taught there, one should look at them in detail.

original: de @82b bas na mang du thos pa des thos pa tsam gyis chos smra bar mi bya bar de las ldog par bya zhing mngon par shes pa thob nas gzod 'gro ba'i don bya ste /
analyzed: de @82b bas na mang du thos pa des thos pa tsam gyis chos smra bar mi bya bar de las ldog par bya zhing mngon par shes pa thob nas gzod 'gro ba'i don bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one who has heard much should not teach the Dharma just by hearing it, but should turn away from that and, having attained the superknowledges, then work for the welfare of beings.

original: 'di ni ldog par bya ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: 'di ni ldog par bya ba'i yan lag go //
translated: This is the branch of turning away.

original: de ltar chos smra ba las ldog cing spros pa spangs pa de 'di snyam du /🔽da dung bdag gis phung po la mkhas par bya ba yang yongs su ma gtugs /
analyzed: de ltar chos smra ba las ldog cing spros pa spangs pa de 'di snyam du / da dung bdag gis phung po la mkhas par bya ba yang yongs su ma gtugs /
translated: Thus, one who has turned away from teaching the Dharma and abandoned conceptual elaboration should think like this:🔽I have not yet fully understood the skill in the aggregates.

original: khams dang skye mched la mkhas par bya ba yang yongs su ma gtugs so //
analyzed: khams dang skye mched la mkhas par bya ba yang yongs su ma gtugs so //
translated: I have not yet fully understood the skill in the elements and sense bases.

original: de dag la mkhas par ma gyur par ni thar pa yang mi thob ste /
analyzed: de dag la mkhas par ma gyur par ni thar pa yang mi thob ste /
translated: Without becoming skilled in those, I will not attain liberation.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga dag la brtson par ma byas par //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga dag la brtson par ma byas par //
translated: Without striving in the five fields of knowledge,

original: 'phags mchog gis kyang thams cad mkhyen nyid mi 'gyur te //
analyzed: 'phags mchog gis kyang thams cad mkhyen nyid mi 'gyur te //
translated: Even the supreme noble ones will not attain omniscience.

original: de bas gzhan dag tshar gcad rjes su gzung phyir ram //
analyzed: de bas gzhan dag tshar gcad rjes su gzung phyir ram //
translated: Therefore, one should strive for that in order to defeat others, to care for others,

original: rang gis kun shes bya phyir de la de brtson byed //
analyzed: rang gis kun shes bya phyir de la de brtson byed //
translated: and to know all things oneself.🔽Moreover, if desire arises for the happiness of gain, honor, fame, reputation, and praise, which are connected with disciples and followers,

original: ces bstan pa'i phyir zhes sems pa dang / gzhan yang slob ma dang yang slob kyi sbyor ba dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa'i bde ba la 'dod pa byung na de ni nges par bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: ces bstan pa'i phyir zhes sems pa dang / gzhan yang slob ma dang yang slob kyi sbyor ba dang / rnyed pa dang / bkur sti dang / grags pa dang sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa'i bde ba la 'dod pa byung na de ni nges par bzlog par bya ste /
translated: then one should definitely stop it.

original: chos thos nas bsgoms pas byang bar ma byas pa na cir yang mi bsngags te /
analyzed: chos thos nas bsgoms pas byang bar ma byas pa na cir yang mi bsngags te /
translated: For if one does not become skilled through hearing and contemplating the Dharma, one will not be praised at all.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa sdong po bkod pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the noble Gaganagañja Sūtra:

original: yang dag sangs rgyas bstan pa 'di //
analyzed: yang dag sangs rgyas bstan pa 'di //
translated: “This teaching of the perfect Buddha

original: thos pa tsam gyis mi 'grub bo //
analyzed: thos pa tsam gyis mi 'grub bo //
translated: is not accomplished by mere hearing.

original: dper na la la chu klung gis //
analyzed: dper na la la chu klung gis //
translated: For example, it is like someone🔽who is helplessly carried away by a river

original: stobs med nan gyis khyer ba dag / skom nas shi bar gyur pa bzhin //
analyzed: stobs med nan gyis khyer ba dag / skom nas shi bar gyur pa bzhin //
translated: and dies of thirst.

original: ma bsgoms chos kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ma bsgoms chos kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The Dharma is like that, if it is not meditated upon.”

original: zhes pa dang / yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / yang gsungs pa /
translated: And it is also said:

original: dper na mtsho chen mnyan pa zhig / skye bo thams cad sgrol byed kyang //
analyzed: dper na mtsho chen mnyan pa zhig / skye bo thams cad sgrol byed kyang //
translated: may deliver all beings,

original: bdag nyid de nang 'chi 'gyur ba //
analyzed: bdag nyid de nang 'chi 'gyur ba //
translated: but he himself may die there.

original: ma bsgoms chos kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ma bsgoms chos kyang de bzhin no //
translated: So it is with the Dharma that is not cultivated.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsgoms pas byang bar mi byed pa'i skyon rab tu mang du bstan te rgyas par de nyid las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bsgoms pas byang bar mi byed pa'i skyon rab tu mang du bstan te rgyas par de nyid las shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is taught that there are many faults of not cultivating [the instructions]. This should be understood in detail from that very [text].

original: de bas ji tsam gyis sems mnyam par 'jog par nus pa de tsam gyis gdams ngag go nas tshim par byas la /
analyzed: de bas ji tsam gyis sems mnyam par 'jog par nus pa de tsam gyis gdams ngag go nas tshim par byas la /
translated: Therefore, as much as one is able to rest the mind evenly, one should be satisfied with the instructions.

original: sems kyi ngang tshul 'phral du byung ba yang bla ma la zhu zhing bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: sems kyi ngang tshul 'phral du byung ba yang bla ma la zhu zhing bsgom par bya'o //
translated: And one should consult the guru and meditate on the immediate arising of the mind's nature.

original: tshad ma rnam pa bdun dang / brda sprod pa rnam pa bzhi dang / chos mngon pa rnam pa bdun dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa'i mtshan mas yid mi gdung ste /
analyzed: tshad ma rnam pa bdun dang / brda sprod pa rnam pa bzhi dang / chos mngon pa rnam pa bdun dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa'i sa la sogs pa'i mtshan mas yid mi gdung ste /
translated: One should not be tormented by the names of the seven valid cognitions, the four grammars, the seven abhidharmas, the levels of yoga practice, and so forth.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: don dam pa'i @83a * //🔽rigs pa las //
analyzed: don dam pa'i @83a * //🔽rigs pa las //
translated: In the Ultimate Reasoning:

original: gang zhig bla ma'i man ngag bdud rtsi chu //
analyzed: gang zhig bla ma'i man ngag bdud rtsi chu //
translated: Whoever does not drink the nectar of the guru’s instructions,

original: gdung sel bsel ldan ngoms par mi 'thung bar //🔽de ni bstan bcos don mang mya ngan gyi //
analyzed: gdung sel bsel ldan ngoms par mi 'thung bar // de ni bstan bcos don mang mya ngan gyi //
translated: Which is refreshing, cooling, and satisfying,🔽Will die of thirst in the desert of misery,

original: thang la skom pas gdungs te shi bar zad //
analyzed: thang la skom pas gdungs te shi bar zad //
translated: Despite the many teachings of the treatises.

original: ces bshad de bskal pa dpag tu med par ngal bar byas kyang /
analyzed: ces bshad de bskal pa dpag tu med par ngal bar byas kyang /
translated: Thus, even though you have toiled for countless eons,

original: tha snyad nye bar sbyar ba de dag ni mi zad kyi /
analyzed: tha snyad nye bar sbyar ba de dag ni mi zad kyi /
translated: You will not exhaust the conventional expressions,

original: tshe yongs su gtugs pa kho nar 'gyur bar zad do //
analyzed: tshe yongs su gtugs pa kho nar 'gyur bar zad do //
translated: But will only exhaust your life.

original: de bas na bde mchog phyi ma las kyang /
analyzed: de bas na bde mchog phyi ma las kyang /
translated: Therefore, the Later Supreme Tantra also says:

original: rnal 'byor pa ni phyi rol 'khor //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa ni phyi rol 'khor //
translated: The yogi/nī wanders in the external world,

original: de yi khams rnams zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: de yi khams rnams zad par 'gyur //
translated: And his/her elements are exhausted.

original: de bas phyi rol kun spangs te //
analyzed: de bas phyi rol kun spangs te //
translated: Therefore, abandoning all external [activities],

original: rnal 'byor rol pas gnas par bya //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rol pas gnas par bya // zhes gsungs so //
translated: One should abide in the play of yoga.

original: de bzhin du don dam pa'i rigs pa las kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du don dam pa'i rigs pa las kyang /
translated: And likewise, the Paramārthajñāna-alokā says:

original: yul rnams bgrod cing gdung bas nyen byas kyang //
analyzed: yul rnams bgrod cing gdung bas nyen byas kyang //
translated: Though you travel to places and are tormented by suffering,

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i cha tsam yang mi 'phrad //🔽ces bshad do //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i cha tsam yang mi 'phrad //🔽ces bshad do //
translated: You will not find even a portion of the innate.

original: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la mkhas par yang rnal 'byor gyi mthus dus gcig nyid la 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: phung po dang khams dang skye mched la mkhas par yang rnal 'byor gyi mthus dus gcig nyid la 'gyur gyi /
translated: The yogi/ni becomes skilled in the aggregates, elements, and sense bases simultaneously by the power of yoga.

original: de dag rim par bslabs pa las ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag rim par bslabs pa las ni ma yin te /
translated: This is not through training in them sequentially.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa rdo rje gtsug tor las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa rdo rje gtsug tor las /
translated: As the Noble Vajra-usnisa says,

original: de las shes pa skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: de las shes pa skye bar 'gyur //
translated: From that, knowledge arises.

original: mthos pa yang shes par 'gyur //🔽zhes gsungs la /
analyzed: mthos pa yang shes par 'gyur // zhes gsungs la /
translated: And also, the higher knowledge arises.

original: 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyis zhus pa las kyang /🔽tshig ni gzung bar 'os shing yin gzhungs la //
analyzed: 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyis zhus pa las kyang / tshig ni gzung bar 'os shing yin gzhungs la //
translated: And in the Noble Good-Protector Discourse,🔽The words are worthy to be grasped and are retentive,

original: snyan dngags dang ni bri ba rnams la mkhas //🔽zhes gsungs so //🔽'di dag kyang rnal 'byor gyi mthu las byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: snyan dngags dang ni bri ba rnams la mkhas // zhes gsungs so // 'di dag kyang rnal 'byor gyi mthu las byung ba yin gyi /
translated: Skilled in poetry and in writing.

original: rim gyis bslab pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rim gyis bslab pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
translated: These also arise from the power of yoga, and not from the stage of sequential training.

original: chos mngon pa las kyang /🔽zad par shes pa zag bcas kyang //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las kyang / zad par shes pa zag bcas kyang //
translated: And in the Abhidharma,

original: zhes bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bstan to //
translated: It is taught that the knowledge of extinction is contaminated.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i gdung ba ni yid 'byung ba'i yan lag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'dod pa'i gdung ba ni yid 'byung ba'i yan lag las shes par bya'o //
translated: The affliction of longing for gain and honor is to be understood as a branch of disgust.

original: 'di ni gdung ba bcad pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: 'di ni gdung ba bcad pa'i yan lag go //
translated: This is the branch of cutting off longing.

original: rnam pa thams cad du 'khor ba la yid ma byung bar bsgoms pas byang bar byed nus pa ma yin pas /

analyzed: ji skad du /

analyzed: sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa la chags pa rnams spang bar bya ste /

analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa dpung bzangs kyis zhus pa las gsungs pa /

analyzed: re zhig gcig na dgra yang mdza' bor 'gyur //

analyzed: skye bo dgrar gyur ba dag bshes nyid dang // bzlog pa nyid du mchis pas de slad du //

analyzed: bstod pas bdag dgar ci zhig yod //

original: bdag la bstod pa gzhan yod na //
analyzed: bdag la bstod pa gzhan yod na //

original: smod pas mi dgar ci zhig yod //🔽ces bshad la /

original: rang bzhin 'grogs dka' de dag gis //

translated: You should understand this from the many explanations of the faults of wealth and honor.

analyzed: sems can mos pa sna tshogs pa //

original: rgyal bas kyang ni mi mgu na //
analyzed: rgyal bas kyang ni mi mgu na //

original: bdag 'dra ngan pas smos ci dgos //

original: de bas 'jig rten bsam pa btang //
analyzed: de bas 'jig rten bsam pa btang //

translated: In that way, in order to abandon the five faults, one should rely on the eight applications of abandoning.

analyzed: de la nyes pa lnga ni dbus dang mtha' rnam par 'byed pa'i tshig le'ur byas pa las / le lo dang ni gdams ngag rnams //
translated: As for the five faults, the Verses That Distinguish the Middle from the Extremes says:🔽Laziness, forgetting the instructions,🔽Lack of exertion,

original: brjed dang bying dang rgod pa dang // 'du mi byed dang 'du byed de //🔽'di dag nyes pa lngar 'dod do //
analyzed: brjed dang bying dang rgod pa dang // 'du mi byed dang 'du byed de // 'di dag nyes pa lngar 'dod do //
translated: Exertion,

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: These are asserted to be the five faults.

original: de dag gi gnyen po spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad kyang de nyid las gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag gi gnyen po spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad kyang de nyid las gsungs te /
translated: The eight applications of abandoning that are their antidotes are also taught in that same text:🔽The basis and what is based upon it,

original: gnas dang de la gnas pa dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du'o //
analyzed: gnas dang de la gnas pa dang // rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid du'o //
translated: The cause and the result.🔽Not forgetting the object of meditation,🔽Noticing laxity and excitation,🔽Exerting effort to abandon them,

original: dmigs pa brjed par ma gyur dang // bying dang rgod pa rtog pa dang // de spong mngon par 'du byed dang // zhi tshe rnal du 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa brjed par ma gyur dang // bying dang rgod pa rtog pa dang // de spong mngon par 'du byed dang // zhi tshe rnal du 'jug pa'o //
translated: And when pacified, settling naturally.

original: zhes so // de ltar yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa des zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par bya ba las /
analyzed: zhes so // de ltar yan lag yongs su rdzogs pa des zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bsgom par bya ba las /
translated: Thus, having completed the limbs, one should cultivate serenity and insight.

original: 'dir zhi gnas de ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'dir zhi gnas de ni gnyis te /
translated: Here, serenity is twofold:

original: kha nang du bltas pas thob pa dang kha phyir bltas pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: kha nang du bltas pas thob pa dang kha phyir bltas pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: that attained by looking inward and that attained by looking outward.

original: de la kha nang du bltas pa la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: de la kha nang du bltas pa la yang gnyis te /
translated: Looking inward is also twofold:

original: lus la dmigs pa dang / lus la brten pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lus la dmigs pa dang / lus la brten pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: that which has the body as its object and that which has what is based on the body as its object.

original: de la lus la dmigs pa la yang gsum ste /
analyzed: de la lus la dmigs pa la yang gsum ste /
translated: That which has the body as its object is also threefold:

original: lus nyid la lha'i rnam par dmigs pa dang / keng rus la sogs pa mi sdug par dmigs pa dang / kha tv'i ga la sogs pa mtshan ma khyad par can la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: lus nyid la lha'i rnam par dmigs pa dang / keng rus la sogs pa mi sdug par dmigs pa dang / kha tv'i ga la sogs pa mtshan ma khyad par can la dmigs pa'o //
translated: that which has the body as the object of divine forms, that which has the body as the object of foul things such as skeletons, and that which has the body as the object of special signs such as the khaṭvāṇga.

original: lus la brten pa la dmigs pa yang lnga ste /
analyzed: lus la brten pa la dmigs pa yang lnga ste /
translated: That which has what is based on the body as its object is fivefold:

original: dbugs la dmigs pa dang / mtshan ma phra mo la dmigs pa dang / thig le la dmigs pa dang / 'od zer gyi yan lag la dmigs pa dang / dga' ba dang bde ba la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs la dmigs pa dang / mtshan ma phra mo la dmigs pa dang / thig le la dmigs pa dang / 'od zer gyi yan lag la dmigs pa dang / dga' ba dang bde ba la dmigs pa'o //
translated: that which has the breath as its object, that which has a subtle sign as its object, that which has a drop as its object, that which has a ray of light as its object, and that which has joy and bliss as its object.

original: kha phyir bltas pa la dmigs pa la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: kha phyir bltas pa la dmigs pa la yang gnyis te /
translated: The object of attention that is directed outward is also of two kinds:

original: khyad par can dang / phal pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par can dang / phal pa'o //
translated: distinctive and ordinary.

original: de la khyad par can la yang gnyis te /
analyzed: de la khyad par can la yang gnyis te /
translated: The distinctive is also of two kinds:

original: sku la dmigs pa dang / gsung la dmigs pa'o//
analyzed: sku la dmigs pa dang / gsung la dmigs pa'o//
translated: the object of attention that is directed to the body and the object of attention that is directed to speech.

original: 'di dag ni zhi gnas la 'jug pa'i yan lag go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni zhi gnas la 'jug pa'i yan lag go //
translated: These are the limbs of entering into serenity.

original: ji ltar bsgom pa la 'dir mi brjod de /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom pa la 'dir mi brjod de /
translated: The cultivation of serenity is not explained here because

original: gzhung shin tu mang por 'gyur bas 'jigs pa'i phyir dang / bla ma dam pas nyams su myong ba'i man ngag la brten par rigs kyi /
analyzed: gzhung shin tu mang por 'gyur bas 'jigs pa'i phyir dang / bla ma dam pas nyams su myong ba'i man ngag la brten par rigs kyi /
translated: it would require too many words and because it is proper to rely on the oral instructions of a holy guru for the experience of serenity.

original: bsgom par bya ba'i man ngag ni yi ger gnas pa'i shes @90b par dka' ba'i phyir dang / zhi ba tu ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan pa las bshad pa'i phyir ro //🔽zhi gnas kyi 'bras bu ni lhag mthong yin la /
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba'i man ngag ni yi ger gnas pa'i shes @90b par dka' ba'i phyir dang / zhi ba tu ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong bstan pa las bshad pa'i phyir ro // zhi gnas kyi 'bras bu ni lhag mthong yin la /
translated: The oral instructions for cultivation are difficult to understand from the written word, and because they are explained in the instructions on serenity and insight.🔽The result of serenity is insight.

original: lhag mthong gi 'bras bu ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: lhag mthong gi 'bras bu ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa yin te /
translated: The result of insight is the union of serenity and insight.

original: de yang dngos po gang yang mi gnas pas dngos po med pa bye brag tu mthong la /
analyzed: de yang dngos po gang yang mi gnas pas dngos po med pa bye brag tu mthong la /
translated: Moreover, since no entity whatsoever remains, non-entity is specifically seen.

original: de nyid kyi tshe sems rtse gcig tu gyur pas dmigs pa du ma rab tu rgyug pa rab tu zhi bar gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa'i gnas skabs 'dir ye shes kyi dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / ye shes nyid tshul ji ltar gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang / bdag cag dbu ma pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa la khyad par ci yod pa dag la /
analyzed: de nyid kyi tshe sems rtse gcig tu gyur pas dmigs pa du ma rab tu rgyug pa rab tu zhi bar gnas pa'i phyir ro // de ltar zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa'i gnas skabs 'dir ye shes kyi dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / ye shes nyid tshul ji ltar gnas pa dang / rnal 'byor spyod pa pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dang / bdag cag dbu ma pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong zung du 'brel pa la khyad par ci yod pa dag la /
translated: At that time, since the mind has become one-pointed, the many objects of observation are pacified and remain still.

original: bdag gi blo rab tu 'phro bar bzod mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag gi blo rab tu 'phro bar bzod mod kyi /
translated: In this context of the union of śamatha and vipaśyanā, I can bear to spread out my mind to the extent of the difference between the object of observation of wisdom and the wisdom itself, the way in which śamatha and vipaśyanā are practiced by Yogācāras and the way in which śamatha and vipaśyanā are practiced by us Madhyamakas.

original: 'dir nyams su blang ba'i thabs tsam gsal bar byed 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'dir nyams su blang ba'i thabs tsam gsal bar byed 'dod kyi /
translated: However, here I wish to clarify just the method of practice.

original: grub pa'i mtha' gtan la 'bebs par 'dod pa ni ma yin pa dang / 'phags pa n'a g'a rdzun la sogs pas gsal bar mdzad pa las /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' gtan la 'bebs par 'dod pa ni ma yin pa dang / 'phags pa n'a g'a rdzun la sogs pas gsal bar mdzad pa las /
translated: I do not wish to settle a philosophical tenet,

original: cung zad kyang sus kyang smrar med pa'i phyir rgya cher ma spros so //
analyzed: cung zad kyang sus kyang smrar med pa'i phyir rgya cher ma spros so //
translated: and since no one can say anything about it at all, as is clear from the noble Nagajuna's Refutation of Objections and so on, I have not elaborated on it.

original: da ni gzhan 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhan 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now I will discuss this other point.

original: ci mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas mdun du ma byas par lhag mthong skye bar rung ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas mdun du ma byas par lhag mthong skye bar rung ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: Is it possible to generate insight without first achieving serenity that is conjoined with the mental attentions that focus on the signs of things?

original: de ni rung ba nyid de /
analyzed: de ni rung ba nyid de /
translated: It is possible.

original: mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas so sor rtog pa'i shes rab nyid las mtshan ma med pa'i lhag mthong rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'byung ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas so sor rtog pa'i shes rab nyid las mtshan ma med pa'i lhag mthong rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes 'byung ste /
translated: Non-discursive transcendent wisdom, which is insight free of signs, arises from the wisdom that discerns the absence of signs, which is serenity free of signs.

original: de ltar yang 'phags pa 'od srungs kyis zhus pa las /🔽shing gnyis drud pa las ni me 'byung ste //
analyzed: de ltar yang 'phags pa 'od srungs kyis zhus pa las / shing gnyis drud pa las ni me 'byung ste //
translated: The noble Kasyapa-parivarta-sutra says:🔽Fire arises from rubbing two sticks together,

original: byung ba de yis de nyid bsreg pa ltar //
analyzed: byung ba de yis de nyid bsreg pa ltar //
translated: and that which arises burns those two sticks.

original: de bzhin shes rab dbang po skyes nas kyang //
analyzed: de bzhin shes rab dbang po skyes nas kyang //
translated: In the same way, when the faculty of wisdom arises,

original: skyes pa de yis de nyid sreg par byed //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes pa de yis de nyid sreg par byed // ces gsungs so //
translated: That man burns himself.

original: so sor rtog pa'i shes rab ni zhi gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i shes rab ni zhi gnas ma yin te /
translated: Discriminating wisdom is not calm abiding.

original: rnam pa du mas dmigs so zhe na /
analyzed: rnam pa du mas dmigs so zhe na /
translated: It observes with many aspects.

original: de lta na ni zhi gnas kyang zhi gnas ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta na ni zhi gnas kyang zhi gnas ma yin te /
translated: If that is so, then calm abiding is not calm abiding.

original: skad cig du ma dang cha shas du ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig du ma dang cha shas du ma la dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It observes many moments and many parts.

original: gzhan yang zhi gnas las lhag mthong la 'jug pa na yang ji ltar so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis mtshams sbyor bar mi byed /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhi gnas las lhag mthong la 'jug pa na yang ji ltar so sor rtog pa'i shes rab kyis mtshams sbyor bar mi byed /
translated: Moreover, when one enters into insight from calm abiding, how does discriminating wisdom not connect them?

original: de mi byed pa ni 'ga' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de mi byed pa ni 'ga' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It does not connect them in some cases.

original: de la 'di'i rim pa yang lus kho na la brtags pas 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'di'i rim pa yang lus kho na la brtags pas 'grub pa ste /
translated: The stages of that are also accomplished by investigating the body alone.

original: 'phags pa n'a g'a rdzu na'i zhal snga nas /
analyzed: 'phags pa n'a g'a rdzu na'i zhal snga nas /
translated: Ārya Nāgārjuna says:

original: @91a * // 'jig rten rnam par rtog las byung //
analyzed: @91a * // 'jig rten rnam par rtog las byung //
translated: The world arises from conceptuality.

original: rnam par rtog pa sems las byung //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa sems las byung //
translated: Conceptualization arises from mind.

original: sems kyang lus las byung bas na //
analyzed: sems kyang lus las byung bas na //
translated: Mind also arises from the body.

original: de phyir lus la dpyad par bya //🔽zhes bshad la /
analyzed: de phyir lus la dpyad par bya //🔽zhes bshad la /
translated: Therefore, investigate the body.

original: 'phags pa n'a g'ardzu na'i zhal snga nas kyang bshad pa /🔽lus med rnam par shes pa ni //
analyzed: 'phags pa n'a g'ardzu na'i zhal snga nas kyang bshad pa / lus med rnam par shes pa ni //
translated: The noble Nāgārjuna also explains:🔽Know that consciousness without a body

original: med ces bya ba rtog par gyis //🔽zhes bshad cing /
analyzed: med ces bya ba rtog par gyis // zhes bshad cing /
translated: is not nonexistent.

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: And a sūtra says:

original: rnam par shes pa ni lus las mi 'da'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni lus las mi 'da'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Consciousness does not go beyond the body.

original: de bas na chos thams cad sems la bsdu ba dang / sems lus la bsdu ba dang / lus chos kyi dbyings su nye bar rnal 'byor du bya ba 'di ni man ngag go //
analyzed: de bas na chos thams cad sems la bsdu ba dang / sems lus la bsdu ba dang / lus chos kyi dbyings su nye bar rnal 'byor du bya ba 'di ni man ngag go //
translated: Therefore, the instruction is to gather all phenomena into the mind, to gather the mind into the body, and to practice yoga by bringing the body into the dharmadhātu.

original: yang na lus dang sems tha dad pa la dmigs par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na lus dang sems tha dad pa la dmigs par bya ste /
translated: Alternatively, you should focus on the difference between the body and mind.

original: 'di'i man ngag ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i man ngag ni sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa las shes par bya'o //
translated: The instruction for this is to be understood from the recollection of the Buddha.

original: de bas na mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas la brten pa bas ni /
analyzed: de bas na mtshan ma dang bcas pa'i zhi gnas la brten pa bas ni /
translated: Therefore, compared to the approach of cultivating vipaśyanā on the basis of śamatha that involves characteristics,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas la dmigs nas lhag mthong bskyed pa'i phyogs 'di bsngags te /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i zhi gnas la dmigs nas lhag mthong bskyed pa'i phyogs 'di bsngags te /
translated: this approach of cultivating vipaśyanā on the basis of śamatha that is free from characteristics is praised.

original: de'i gnas pa brten pa dang / zhi gnas 'ba' zhig gis nyon mongs pa rab tu gnon cing sel ba dang / 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnas pa brten pa dang / zhi gnas 'ba' zhig gis nyon mongs pa rab tu gnon cing sel ba dang / 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the basis of the latter, because it is the support of the latter. It is the subduer of the afflictions, because it suppresses the afflictions with just śamatha. It is the cause that is in accordance with the result, because it is the cause that is in accordance with the result of the ārya’s path.

original: 'dir ni bdag gi bla ma'i man ngag las byung 'di bris pas //
analyzed: 'dir ni bdag gi bla ma'i man ngag las byung 'di bris pas //
translated: Here I have written this based on the oral instructions of my guru.

original: nye bar 'phel ba'i dge ba'i zla zer dri ma med pa des //
analyzed: nye bar 'phel ba'i dge ba'i zla zer dri ma med pa des //
translated: By that stainless moonlight of increasing virtue,

original: 'gro ba'i mi shes rab rib mun bsal gdung ba zhi byas te //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i mi shes rab rib mun bsal gdung ba zhi byas te //
translated: may the darkness of the eye disease of ignorance of migrating beings be cleared away, may their suffering be pacified,🔽and may they attain the object of suchness with the eye of wisdom.

original: shes rab mig gis de bzhin nyid yul rab gsal thob par shog / bdag kyang rnam par g-yeng sogs rlung sogs rab zhi mun bsal nas //
analyzed: shes rab mig gis de bzhin nyid yul rab gsal thob par shog / bdag kyang rnam par g-yeng sogs rlung sogs rab zhi mun bsal nas //
translated: May I also, having cleared away the darkness of the winds of distraction and so on,🔽quickly come to see the same sphere of activity as the lords of sages.

original: myur du thub dbang rnams dang spyod yul gcig la lta bar shog / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u zhes bya ba slob dpon byang chub bzang pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: myur du thub dbang rnams dang spyod yul gcig la lta bar shog / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi le'u zhes bya ba slob dpon byang chub bzang pos mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the chapter on the accumulations for samādhi, composed by Ācārya Bodhibhadra.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po birya tsandra las zhus te /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po birya tsandra las zhus te /
translated: It was requested from the Indian preceptor Viricyan.

original: bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge slong chos kyi shes rab kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: bod kyi lo ts'a ba dge slong chos kyi shes rab kyis bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
translated: The Tibetan translator, the monk Chökyi Sherab, translated, requested, and finalized this.
